velocityRadialHeliocentric.comment: HI line widths available in Koribalski et al. (2004)
HI line widths available in Karachentsev et al. (2001a)
Stellar velocity gradient constrained to <5 km s-1 at 90% confidence
Stellar velocities based on carbon stars; HI boundaries between LMC, SMC, bridge, and interface regions not clearly defined
Castro et al. (2008) obtain stellar velocities for ~200 massive blue stars and find that their kinematics closely trace the HI rotation curve
Stellar velocity dispersion rises rapidly toward center and presents strong evidence for a supermassive black hole (e.g., see also van der Marel et al. 1997)

metallicityStellar.comment: Likely significant age spread and gradients?

comment.value: Distance based quantities are the mean of those derived assuming the 'Hubble flow' and 'Nearby' methods.

velocityRadialHeliocentric.comment: HI line widths available in Koribalski et al. (2004)
HI line widths available in Begum et al. (2008b) and Huchtmeier et al. (2003)

comment.value: Loose NGC 3109 subgroup. Interacting with Antlia?

velocityRadialHeliocentric.comment: Stellar velocity dispersion based on four stars
See also Huchtmeier & Richter (1986); HI line widths available in Longmore et al. (1982) and Huchtmeier & Richter (1986)
Velocity difference of 8.4 +/- 1.4 km s-1 between stars in the east and west
Stellar velocity dispersion corresponds to dominant component, and there is evidence for a hotter component with velocity dispersion ~ 9 km s-1

metallicityStellar.comment: HRS of a single star in Simon et al. (2010)

comment.value: Loose NGC 3109 subgroup. Interacting with NGC 3109?

velocityRadialHeliocentric.comment: HI rotational velocity measured at r = 1.5 arcmin

referencePrimary.reference: A. G. Wilson. Reported in Holmberg (1958)

metallicityStellar.comment: Derived in E. Skillman et al., (2012 in preparation)

velocityRadialHeliocentric.comment: HI velocity dispersion shows significant spatial variation
Stellar kinematics derived using 10 young B supergiants + HIi regions; HI gradient of ~1.3 km s-1 arcmin-1
HI measurements complex due to location!
Demers et al. (2006) obtain velocities for >100 AGB stars.

comment.value: Zone of obscuration. Binary with B?

velocityRadialHeliocentric.comment: HI cloud offset from optical center of Phoenix, proposed as supernova-driven outflow; HI velocity gradient of ~10 km s-1 observed over ~8 arcmin
HI rotational velocity measured at r = 2 arcmin; see also Huchtmeier et al. (2003), Begum et al. (2008b), and Swaters et al. (2009)
HI velocity gradient of ~3.3 km s-1 arcmin-1

comment.value: Member of the Canes Venatici I cloud

velocityRadialHeliocentric.comment: See also Begum et al. (2008b)
Stellar velocity gradient of 5.5 +/- 0.5 km s-1 deg-1
Accounts for measured rotation velocity.
HI line widths available in Koribalski et al. (2004)
HI velocity gradient of ~42 km s-1 measured over ~3 arcmin
Stellar velocity dispersion based on three stars
HI velocity gradient of ~2.5 km s-1 arcmin-1

comment.value: Zone of obscuration. Binary with A?

velocityRadialHeliocentric.comment: HI structure consists of a rotating disk and a kinematically distinct, elongated "spur"
Stellar velocity gradient of 2.5 +/- 0.8 km s-1 deg-1
Not associated with HI detection in Blitz & Robishaw (2000)
Lumpy HI velocity distribution, with some evidence of an overall velocity gradient

comment.value: Gibson Reaves gave this galaxy his initials

velocityRadialHeliocentric.comment: Stellar velocity gradient of 6.3 +/- 0.2 km s-1 deg-1
HI line widths available in Huchtmeier & Richter (1986)

comment.value: Distance based quantities are the mean of those derived assuming the 'Hubble flow' and 'Nearby' methods.

velocityRadialHeliocentric.comment: HI line widths available in Begum et al. (2008b)
Tentative stellar velocity gradient across minor axis of 7.7 +/- 1.2 km s-1; unassociated with nearby HI cloud
Stellar velocity gradient of 5.5 +/- 1.2 km s-1 deg-1
Gaseous disk embedded in complex, extended HI distribution, (with a dispersion of around 30+/-40 km s-1)
Stellar velocities based on red giant branch stars; stellar velocity gradient of 8.3 km s-1 deg-1; HI boundaries between LMC, SMC, bridge, and interface regions not clearly defined
See Huchtmeier et al. (2000) for attempted HI observations
HI velocity gradient of 6 km s-1 arcmin-1.

metallicityStellar.comment: Assumes an age of 4 Gyr; for an ancient population, find [Fe/H]

property.name: extinction
property.description: Foreground reddening, E(B-V), measured directly from the Schlegel et al 1998 maps (they do not include the recalibration by Schlafly & Finbiener 2011)

property.name: magnitudeApparentV
property.description: Apparent V magnitude in Vega mags

property.name: massDynamicalHalfLightRadius
property.description: Dyanmical mass within the half-light radius.

property.name: massNeutralHydrogen
property.description: Mass of neutral hydrogen gas (calculated for the adopted distance modulus), M_HI (M_sun)

property.name: massStellar
property.description: Stellar mass (often computed assuming a V-band stellar mass-to-light ratio of 1 in Solar units).

property.name: membership
property.description: Group membership (G=Milky Way; A=M31; L=Local Group; N=Nearby).

property.name: positionAngle
property.description: Position Angle of major axis in degrees measured east from north

property.name: positionHeliocentricCartesian
property.description: Position in a Cartesian coordinate system centered on the Sun.

property.name: radiusHalfLightAngular
property.description: Half-light radius measured on major axis, rh(arcmins)

property.name: radiusExponentialScaleLengthV
property.description: Radial exponential scale length in V-band, reV(arcmins)

property.name: radiusExponentialScaleLengthI
property.description: Radial exponential scale length in I-band, reI(arcmins)

property.name: surfaceBrightnessEffectiveV
property.description: Mean surface brightness within the half-light radius.

property.name: velocityAzimuthalMilkyWay
property.description: Azimuthal velocity relative to Milky Way center.

property.name: velocityLocalGroup
property.description: Velocity relative to Local Group center.

property.name: velocityMilkyWay
property.description: Velocity relative to Milky Way center.

property.name: velocityRadialMilkyWay
property.description: Radial velocity relative to Milky Way center.

property.name: velocityVerticalMilkyWay
property.description: Vertical velocity relative to Milky Way center.
